ProductServiceCampaignItem.name: ProductServiceCampaignItem
ProductServiceCampaignItem.description: Represents a product service campaign's asset.

ActionableListMemberId.description: The actionable list member that’s associated with an asset in a product service campaign.

AssetId.description: The asset associated with the product service campaign. Must be present if Product2Id is not present.

GeneratedTargetRecordType.description: Specifies the type of the target records that are generated for the product service campaign item.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date and time that the asset was last modified. Its UI label is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date and time that the asset was last viewed.

Product2Id.description: The ID of the Product2 associated with this campaign. The UI label is Product. Must be present if AssetID is not present.

ProductServiceCampaignId.description: Required. The item’s parent product service campaign record.

ProductServiceCampaignItemNumber.description: The ID of the product service campaign item.

SerializedProductId.description: The serialized product associated with the product service campaign item.

Status.description: The status of the product service campaign item. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: New—Product service campaign item created, but there hasn’t yet been any activity. In Progress—Product service campaign item has begun. On Hold—Product service campaign item is paused. Completed—Product service campaign item is complete. Cannot Complete—Product service campaign item couldn’t be completed. Closed—All product service campaign item and associated activity is complete. Canceled—Product service campaign item is canceled, typically before any work began.

StatusCategory.description: The category that each Status value falls into. The StatusCategory field has eight default values: seven values that are identical to the default Status values, and None for statuses without a status category.If you create custom Status values, you must indicate which category it belongs to. For example, if you create a Waiting for Response value, add it to the On Hold category. To learn which processes reference StatusCategory, see How are Status Categories Used?
